patterns.name: Tiny T-Rex
patterns.description: Create your own tiny T-Rex with this easy-to-follow pattern.

details.title: Skill Level
details.content: Beginner

details.title: Finished Size
details.content: Approximately 6 inches tall

details.title: Materials Needed
details.content:
• Worsted weight yarn in your choice of color (green, orange, pink, red, yellow)
  • Small amount of white yarn for teeth (optional)
  • Size G (4.0 mm) crochet hook
  • Polyester fiberfill stuffing
  • Safety eyes (6 mm) or black embroidery thread
  • Tapestry needle
  • Stitch marker
  • Scissors

details.title: Gauge
details.content: Not critical for this project. Ensure stitches are tight to prevent stuffing from showing.

details.title: Abbreviations
details.content:
• st(s) - stitch(es)
  • ch - chain
  • sc - single crochet
  • inc - increase (2 sc in same st)
  • dec - decrease (sc two sts together)
  • sl st - slip stitch
  • FO - finish off
  • (...) - repeat the instructions within parentheses

instructionsSections.title: Head
steps: Ch 2.
Rnd 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (6 sts)
Rnd 2: Inc in each st around. (12 sts)
Rnd 3: (Sc in next st, inc in next st) around. (18 sts)
Rnd 4: (Sc in next 2 sts, inc in next st) around. (24 sts)
Rnd 5: (Sc in next 3 sts, inc in next st) around. (30 sts)
Rnd 6-10: Sc in each st around. (30 sts)
Rnd 11: (Sc in next 3 sts, dec over next 2 sts) around. (24 sts)
Rnd 12: (Sc in next 2 sts, dec over next 2 sts) around. (18 sts)
Rnd 13: (Sc in next st, dec over next 2 sts) around. (12 sts)
Stuff the head firmly.
Rnd 14: Dec over next 2 sts around. (6 sts)
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

instructionsSections.title: Body
steps: Ch 2.
Rnd 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (6 sts)
Rnd 2: Inc in each st around. (12 sts)
Rnd 3: (Sc in next st, inc in next st) around. (18 sts)
Rnd 4: (Sc in next 2 sts, inc in next st) around. (24 sts)
Rnd 5-9: Sc in each st around. (24 sts)
Rnd 10: (Sc in next 2 sts, dec over next 2 sts) around. (18 sts)
Rnd 11: (Sc in next st, dec over next 2 sts) around. (12 sts)
Stuff the body firmly.
Rnd 12: Dec over next 2 sts around. (6 sts)
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

instructionsSections.title: Assembly
steps: Sew the head to the body.
Sew the arms to the sides of the body.
Sew the legs to the bottom of the body.
Sew the tail to the back of the body.
Embroider eyes or attach safety eyes.
Embroider teeth with white yarn if desired.

patterns.name: Awesome Whales
patterns.description: Bring the ocean to your home with these awesome whale patterns. These underwater creatures come in many color variations.

details.title: Skill Level
details.content: Beginner

details.title: Finished Size
details.content: Approximately 8 inches long

details.title: Materials Needed
details.content:
• Worsted weight yarn in blue or your choice of color
  • Size G (4.0 mm) crochet hook
  • Polyester fiberfill stuffing
  • Safety eyes (6 mm) or black embroidery thread
  • Tapestry needle
  • Stitch marker
  • Scissors

details.title: Gauge
details.content: Not critical for this project. Ensure stitches are tight to prevent stuffing from showing.

details.title: Abbreviations
details.content:
• st(s) - stitch(es)
  • ch - chain
  • sc - single crochet
  • inc - increase (2 sc in same st)
  • dec - decrease (sc two sts together)
  • sl st - slip stitch
  • FO - finish off
  • (...) - repeat the instructions within parentheses

instructionsSections.title: Body
steps: Ch 2.
Rnd 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (6 sts)
Rnd 2: Inc in each st around. (12 sts)
Rnd 3: (Sc in next st, inc in next st) around. (18 sts)
Rnd 4: (Sc in next 2 sts, inc in next st) around. (24 sts)
Rnd 5-10: Sc in each st around. (24 sts)
Rnd 11: (Sc in next 2 sts, dec over next 2 sts) around. (18 sts)
Rnd 12: (Sc in next st, dec over next 2 sts) around. (12 sts)
Stuff the body firmly.
Rnd 13: Dec over next 2 sts around. (6 sts)
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

instructionsSections.title: Fins and Tail
steps: Ch 2.
Rnd 1: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (4 sts)
Rnd 2: Inc in each st around. (8 sts)
Rnd 3-4: Sc in each st around. (8 sts)
Fasten off, leaving a tail for sewing.
Make 2 fins and 1 tail, then sew them to the body.

instructionsSections.title: Assembly
steps: Sew the fins and tail to the body.
Embroider eyes or attach safety eyes.
Finish off by weaving in the loose ends.

patterns.name: Happy Tardigrade
patterns.description: This cute water bear makes a great cuddle partner.

details.title: Skill Level
details.content: Intermediate

details.title: Finished Size
details.content: Approximately 5 inches long

details.title: Materials Needed
details.content:
• Worsted weight yarn in grey or your choice of color
  • Size G (4.0 mm) crochet hook
  • Polyester fiberfill stuffing
  • Safety eyes (6 mm) or black embroidery thread
  • Tapestry needle
  • Stitch marker
  • Scissors

details.title: Gauge
details.content: Not critical for this project. Ensure stitches are tight to prevent stuffing from showing.

details.title: Abbreviations
details.content:
• st(s) - stitch(es)
  • ch - chain
  • sc - single crochet
  • inc - increase (2 sc in same st)
  • dec - decrease (sc two sts together)
  • sl st - slip stitch
  • FO - finish off
  • (...) - repeat the instructions within parentheses)

instructionsSections.title: Body
steps: Ch 2.
Rnd 1: 6 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (6 sts)
Rnd 2: Inc in each st around. (12 sts)
Rnd 3: (Sc in next st, inc in next st) around. (18 sts)
Rnd 4: (Sc in next 2 sts, inc in next st) around. (24 sts)
Rnd 5-8: Sc in each st around. (24 sts)
Rnd 9: (Sc in next 2 sts, dec over next 2 sts) around. (18 sts)
Rnd 10: (Sc in next st, dec over next 2 sts) around. (12 sts)
Stuff the body firmly.
Rnd 11: Dec over next 2 sts around. (6 sts)
Fasten off, leaving a long tail for sewing.

instructionsSections.title: Legs
steps: Ch 2.
Rnd 1: 4 sc in 2nd ch from hook. (4 sts)
Rnd 2: Inc in each st around. (8 sts)
Rnd 3-4: Sc in each st around. (8 sts)
Fasten off, leaving a tail for sewing.
Make 6 legs and sew them evenly to the sides of the body.

instructionsSections.title: Assembly
steps: Sew the legs to the body.
Embroider eyes or attach safety eyes.
Weave in all loose ends.

Weave in all loose ends.
